author: Staff Reporter
text:
The gaur, a protected animal, was hunted for its horn and skin inside the Arasampet Reserve Forest.

Personnel attached to the Odugathur Forest Range have arrested two persons for hunting a Gaur inside the Arasampet Reserve Forest. They killed the protected species (under Schedule 1 of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972) for its horn and skin.

Officials said the range office had received a tip off that men were involved in hunting on the evening of February 12. A team of 20 persons led by Odugathur range officer R. Muralidharan rushed to the RF and launched a search. They found the carcass of a Gaur hid under a bush.

They nabbed two persons – Kathavarayan (24) and Sekar alias Senthamarai (55) of Melarasampattu on the next day and recovered a country-made gun from them. They were produced before Judicial Magistrate - 3, Vellore and remanded.

Protected species

Forest department officers said Gaur was a protected species, and the hunted animal was the only one that was spotted in this forest range.“They had shot the animal in its chest. They had cut its head and hid the carcass under a bush,” M. Babu, forester, Odugathur range said.

In their confession, the duo said that they were planning to remove the bison’s horn and skin and sell it.

“We had already created awareness among the villagers along the reserve forest area. We will continue to inquire in this case, as we need to keep a watch if the Gaur horn was being smuggled. We will step up monitoring in the forest areas to prevent such incidents,” an officer said.
title: Two held for hunting Gaur
